emp_rate.long_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population. Based on American Community Survey Table 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
emp_rate.short_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B23025, via the API

emp_rate.statement: {value} of the population in {region_name} is employed.

labor_participate_rate.long_description: The percentage of individuals aged 16 years and over in the labor force. In other words, the labor force participation rate is the number of people who are either working or actively looking for work. The labor force participation rate is often used by economists as an indicator of economic development and growth. /n Here the labor force includes all people classified in the civilian labor force and members of the members of the U.S. Armed Forces (people on active duty with the United States Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps, or Coast Guard). The civilian labor force population consists of all people aged 16 and older who are classified as employed and unemployed. /n Based on American Community Survey Table 5-year estimates from 2015 to 2021.
labor_participate_rate.short_description: The percentage of individuals aged 16 years and over in the labor force.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table S2301_C02_001, via the API

labor_participate_rate.statement: {value} of the population in {region_name} is participating in the civilian job force.
